arm_group.arm_group_label: Tourniquet, pain, nerve injury, sensory nerve function

brief_summary.textblock:
There are a number of risk factors for development of chronic pain that have been evaluated
      including age, gender, type and duration of surgery, duration of pain prior to surgery and
      tourniquet application. There is some scientific evidence from animal studies demonstrating
      that prolonged tourniquet application can result in lack of oxygen supply to nerves, and
      subsequent nerve damage resulting in chronic pain. This theory has not been proven in
      humans. In this study the investigators will indirectly assess the evidence for
      abnormalities caused by tourniquet application on subjects' nerves using well established
      devices to determine the function of these nerves.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Tourniquet on Sensory Nerve Conduction Threshold (sNCT) and OxyNeuroGram (ONG) Index- A Volunteer Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy adults

          -  Over 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Neurological disease

          -  Diabetes mellitus

          -  History of nerve injury

          -  Chronic pain

          -  Alcoholism

          -  Blood pressure measurements greater than 140/80 and infection in the monitored area

intervention.arm_group_label: Tourniquet, pain, nerve injury, sensory nerve function

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Tourniquet on Sensory Nerve Conduction Threshold (sNCT) and OxyNeuroGram (ONG) Index- A Volunteer Study
